Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, a bit noisy from room to room. Good air conditioning. Friendly staff. Very very clean. Bad breakfast! not value for money... just go outside and grab a breakfast at any coffee-shop: it's better and cheaper! Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE street & horrible service”
Reviews.Author: GingerLilyParis
Reviews.Content: Feels worse than a hostel but priced like a hotel. We reserved a room here while in Madrid with our teenage daughter. We had a very difficult time locating the hotel then when we did find it we were discusted at the way the street felt. Prostitutes line the whole street every couple of steps (which seems odd since the police station is very near). We went in and it felt CREEPY inside so we told the manager that we were deceived by their ad and did not want to stay at this location. They refused to give us our money back. We paid for that night although we stayed somewhere else... that is HOW BAD the place was!!! There are so many lovely places nearby that are NOT discusting or on this CREEPY street that I highly recomend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “If it looks like a hostel....and feels like a hostel....”
Reviews.Author: travelbugRNG
Reviews.Content: ...You probably should not be paying the price of a hotel! I am very surprised by all of the positive reviews. Walking in to the reception area I thought maybe the hotel was under renovation, but it appeared not to be after all. There was hair in the bed. There was hair in the shower. The AC would not cool down the room, which might not have been a problem with a room on a lower floor or the window actually opened. We asked twice to have the AC examined, both times the problem appeared to be fixed but was not. Was too warm to sleep, and in addition to the very thin walls, which even allowed you to hear the person next room using the bathroom and blowing his or her nose. Wifi connection did not work for our iPhones, and it is only offered in the common area. Location clearly is what you pay for and it is quiet convenient, right in the Puerta del Sol 1 min from the metro. The receptionists were nice and helpful. However, would not recommend this area to stay in unless you enjoy being amongst masses of tourist. Was not happy paying the price upon departure though was happy to get out ASAP in the morning. Stay at your own risk- consider yourself warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the center of town!”
Reviews.Author: Yesenia V
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Eden Paraiso Neptuno. I had booked a single room, but was kindly upgraded to a room overlooking the street with a balcony (which is what I had wished for). I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, so I can't coment on that...but I can say that the staff was always helpful and with a smile. it's 3 steps from the metro, which is a big plus. the room was a perfect size for me...the wifi does not reach the rooms (at least mine, 3rd floor) but that was not much of an issue, I went to the breakfast room (1st floor) and the wifi worked perfectly. It is a noisy area (like most city centers), but I knew from the start before booking, and that was not an issue for me...it was nice to see all the people walk by from my balcony. The airconditioner worked great...cooled the room very quickly, and that was one of the reasons I booked this hotel, because of the individual air conditioners in each room, as some other hotels, didnt have that option. (some hotels have AC that they control). The room was nicely decorated, modern, clean, and a great value for what I paid. I would definitly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Zafina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Eden Paraiso Neptuno in Madrid for one night. The hotel is 1 min away from the nearest metro station and neraby the hotel were supermarkets, shops and restaurants. The location of hotel is the best, because it is right on the shopping street in central Madrid. It was great! The staff was helpful and was english speaking. For this price the hotel was great. If we go back to Madrid we definitely we will stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: newchronos
Reviews.Content: The location is very central. Close to the metro and walkable to the Atocha train station. The rooms are new and clean. Our room had AC. The hotel let us check in early without any issue. Giving it a 3 star because the walls are thin. We stayed here 4 nights and one night we had a hard time sleeping because the neighbor had the TV on all night. Other than that, this was a great place for us for we only needed a basic room to stay in Madrid while we explore the city day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but good value”
Reviews.Author: Melissa H
Reviews.Content: I had a triple room in this hotel, I found it a compact and viable option, the room was clean and air-conditioned. Most importantly it's location just of the main square (SOL) made it easy to find and easy to explore Madrid. Free Wi Fi if you went and sat on the first floor dining area and the staff were very helpful. We opted not to buy the breakfast with the hotel as it was cheaper to go outdoors with lots of options about but I would stay here again for convenience since it was clean and located in a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to see everything ...”
Reviews.Author: FeminineEssence
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Eden Neptuno . We read the reviews previously and the fact that it was in the center of everything we booked it...The hotel has all the basic things you need. It is not a five star hotel but it isn't a hostel either. We had a very clean room with above average furniture, the bathroom is very nice.I was a little surprised , because when you see it from the outside, and the small lobby, you are thinking the worst, but it was a great surprise. All the sight seeing, shopping ,and food is walking distance , even the free shuttle that takes you to the airport...the only bad thing is ,since it is in the center of everything , the city never sleeps....so if your room is towards the street, you may have to be a heavy sleeper because it can be pretty loud,The room has a small window that you can walk out of and enjoy the scene....don't do the breakfast there , it isn't worth 5 euros...but I would stay here again , especially if you are on a budge but you are also used to the finer things in life .

Reviews.Title: “A Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: skittledoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, in a triple room and we had a most enjoyable stay. We definitely would stay in this hotel if we were to visit Madrid again. We wanted for nothing here, and the multlingual staff were so nice. The hotel is located right beside Sol Metro and Gran Via Metro is at the other end of the Montera street. It is so central for visiting everything.When we visited Paris and Milan we stayed in hotels which were not central and we were killed travelling every day.It only costs 2E to get to the Airport, just a few simple changes along the way, whereas a taxi can cost 35 to 40 E.You can close the windows and the shutters to block out the street noise and the air conditioning is brilliant. The hotel is very modern and very clean. What more can I say, stay there you won't be disappointed. And the mattresses were spic and span and excellent quality, if one person moved in the bed the other person wouldn't be disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean room at a reasonable rate, very pleasant staff, we would go back”
Reviews.Author: azsailor
Reviews.Content: We requested a room away from the street as we had heard it could be noisy. We also requested extra pillows because other reviews said the pillows were thin. Easy to ride the mietro practically right to the door (only about 200ft from the metro). When we arrived within 5 minutes 2 different maids brought our extra pillows. And we did get an inside room. It was basic but clean and comfortable. Two twin beds shoved together and the beds were a little firm but comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and clean. It did have a hair dryer. We only stayed one night. The breakfast we thought was very good, It had fruit, cereal, yoghurt, cheese and meats, bread and breakfast rolls. All the staff we were in contact with were very friendly and helpful. One man suggested we take the bus back to the airport as we only had to walk down the street about 10 minutes and the bus took us all the way to terminal 4 at the airport (where international flights leave from). The metro was fun but had to transfer trains a few times. It wasn't the Ritz, but we can do basic with no problem. We would definately go back. A tip to other travellers who have trouble sleeping because of noise - take earplugs with you when you travel. I use the silicone kind and they work wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fool_2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all the reviews on trip advisor. I read lots of warnings about noise and paper thin walls. We got an inside room (not facing the busy street) and the room was clean and very quiet. It's located about 20 paces from the SOL metro stop and so was an absolutely perfect location. It was a basic room - two beds shoved together in the middle of the room and no frills. But we weren't looking for any. We just wanted a cheap, clean room close to the action and that's exactly what we go. No complaints at all from me.

Reviews.Title: “locstion, location, location”
Reviews.Author: russAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly helpful staff. Breakfast adequate. probably better for young people who want to be up all night as the noise in the early hours is constant. On the other hand it is good to hear the streets during the day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Movida”
Reviews.Author: anna-carin
Reviews.Content: First time with husband and friends in June 2010. As we were very pleased with the hotel, I returned with friends in March 2011. The hotel is really in the heart of Madrid. It is close to the underground, but actually we walked a lot and it is close to any place. Even if it is quite noicy in the night, the positive thing is that you have a feeling that it is safe when it is a lot of people around all night. The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast could be much better, but who cares abt. breakfast when you have tapas ;-) The staff is very kind and if I'll go back again to Madrid, I'll go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great value, clean safe and did I say location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: khonkaen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is steps from the puerta del sol and minutes to the plaza mayor an other sites. Close to metro stops so getting around is not a problem. Near many great restaurants and the la latina district for great tapas. Staff is friendly and offers great information in English to guests. The men who manned the front desk were quite helpful in offering places to eat drink and were quick to fix any problems we had. I am writing this review while still a guest and am checking out tomorrow. Te rooms are clean as is the entire hotel that is housed in a building erected in 1890. Breakfast simple but better than nothing ad wi fi is free in the breakfast area. Bathrooms are clean modern and spacious. There is one huge problem with this hotel and why I gave it 3 stars rather than a higher mark it deserved on other areas. It is very very noisy, if you are alight sleeper this is not the place for you. Since it is in the center there is lots of foot traffic all night and noise carries through the walls windows and really seems as if the people are next to you eater than 5 floors below. Also the walls are thin so you hear your neighbor. If you have a young drunk neighbor stumbling home at 3 it can be very annoying. That being said if you can handle the noise than this is a great place tj call home while in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Simple but adequate”
Reviews.Author: shethinks
Reviews.Content: Small hotel. Average room. Simple breakfast (nothing too fancy) but location is the absolute best. Only one real problem for me: walls are paper thin and you can hear everything coming from other rooms and corridors. People at the reception very friendly indeed. Good for a 3night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great price!”
Reviews.Author: IngeVerhoeven
Reviews.Content: - Clean Hotel (not a Hostel, like many others in Madrid) - They change your towels and soap every day, like a real hotel - Very friendly and helpful staff, they gave us a map right a way and explained where we could go to eat or what touristic places there are to see - the location is really super, not a 100 meters away from Puerta del Sol (and the metro) - The pictures on the site are what it looks like in reality - We were lucky to have quiet neighbours, because the walls are indeed paperthin. After checking almost all other hotels in the city, I had the feeling this was the case everywhere though - Breakfast is only 5eur, so not much, and you can decide to take it or not on the spot. There are very cheap breakfast menus in cafés in the neighbourhood (under 5euro)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent surprise - hot spot to be back”
Reviews.Author: snowflakes69
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel, 12 hours before, and we didnt know what we would get. We found a simple hotel, a clean room, an excellent toilet, and a complete silent place to sleep. The location, well .. more than excellent, 1 minute from portas del sol, the city center. For sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: mouradcairo
Reviews.Content: very good value ,clean ,close to every thing in the heart of madrid reception is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: janda0808
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to go ahead and make a booking for this hotel as we had planned to go out clubbing in madrid that night so noise wouldn´t be a problem for us anyway. The hotel is located very close to the sol metro station, it was so close to the metro station that we almost walked past without seeing the sign. The room we had was not big, but it was big enough for all of us. The room was clean and comfortable, the shower was strong and nice, the air con was in working order which was really appreciated, the location was perfect for first time tourists like us. We had three different receptionists during our stay at this hotel and two of them were very polite and spoke very good English. The other receptionist couldn´t speak much English - when we asked where we could buy some bottoles of water from he thought we wanted to check in and kept saying 'no room here'. And most importantly, we did not hear any noise from the street (our room was facing towards the street) or our neighbours during the night. One of us is usually very unhappy with lower budget hotels but even she had a good stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, simple but not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: GaborLondon
Reviews.Content: As i wanted to visit Madrid first time in my life, i found this hotel in the centre of the town. Few mins walk from Plaza Mayor. The room was simple, but clean, no extra. Location is perfect, i never tried any of their services, if has any. All the staff are helpful, speak english. I can recommend this hotel, but the street side is noisy. I have 2 remarks anyway about the place. On the websites u book this hotle as Eden Paraiso Neptuno, but u cant find this name on the hotel. u have to keep your head up, and see a Neptuno label at about 10 metres high on a blue textile sheet. I walked past the hotel 3 times before i found it. And the street where the hotel is a place with full of prostitutes. I felt safe, had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “location, price, clean, just perfect”
Reviews.Author: matt_trav
Reviews.Content: No luxuries of course, but the Neptuno had everything I wanted and more, the price was very good for comfortable and clean room with an amazing bathroom, breakfast was basic but enough and the location just unbeatable, right at the plaza del sol, i'll return 100%

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent 2* hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: MandarineBlossom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Eden Paraiso Neptuno on our short break in Madrid. The most central location you could find in Madrid, though the area isn't one of the nicest. You always have to sacrifice something though. The hotel itself was pretty clean and the room seemed to be in a good condition. As most of the people stated the walls were very soundproof, but we were lucky not to have noisy neighbours. The breakfast was very basic with the loveliest freshly ground coffee and the wifi was available just in the breakfast room. The receptionist (male) was very pleasant and offered us any help needed. We were provided with the free map on arrival and the areas around were explained.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing - noisy, smelly, broken shower - we had to get out”
Reviews.Author: peanutsrio
Reviews.Content: The only two good thing going for this hotel is its location - a short step and you are in the Puerto del Sol. Apart from that it was all disappointing. We booked requesting a quiet room and given one at the front overlooking the noisy street. They let us change to one at the back, but it was very smelly - musty. We couldn't stand that so switched back to the front room. Then the shower didn't work - ran cold and leaked, flooding the floor. The receptiont was very helpful, but said that the shower needed running for 5 minutes to become hot. We explained the problem with the leak. He came up and ran the shower for several minutes - the leaking water reached the floor outside the bathroom. The floorthere was warped - so clearly the leak was not a new problem. He knew waht to do and brought several towels and stuffed them round the base of the shower unit. The noise from the street in the night was terrible if you want to sleep - we kept waking. I suppose it would be fine if you were out there joining in. But not good if you actually want to sleep at night. The breakfast was poor but it didn't matter as by then we had already decided to change hotels. We managed to book that by internet using Wifi, which was only available in the breakfast area (not in the rooms). We are now in a lovely clean Ibis hotel, only 20 mins by metro from Sol What a difference! and 20 euros a night cheaper! (if booking by internet). That pays for our Wifi in the room and a meal too - plus a good nights sleep and working facilities. I have to say, though, that the receptionists at the Neptuno were helpful (it wasn't their fault) and apologetic when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary, it may not be what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Pokeeman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location if you want to be in the heart of the busiest part of the old city, the Plaza del Sol. It is an easy walk to the Museums, shopping, food, and the main night life. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. If you are only staying a night or two, the hotel is fine. We stayed 5 nights.............. Our cabby (35 Euro cab ride from the airport) left us off in the Plaza del Sol, and pointed to a building and said the hotel was over there. Wrong. After 10 minutes we found it on the other side of the plaza, next to the tattoo parlor. Not to worry, the red light district is at the other end of the street. It is very non-descript hotel. Just a doorway off an artery of the plaza. There is a very narrow hallway, with the main desk located a few feet from the front door. There is a lounge with free internet access on the second floor. Our initial triple room was located in the front, and it was exceptionally noisy even with the window closed. No sleep for 2 nights. We changed to a smaller room in the back, which was very quiet but had a strong unpleasant odor in the bathroom. The walls are fairly thin, so you do get some noise from adjacent rooms. After the third night, I was regretting not getting a room in a quieter, less crowded area. After traveling from the U.S. all night, the last thing I needed was no sleep. The subway is so easy that there is no reason to stay in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if location suits your needs”
Reviews.Author: CupCaketheBold
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Eden Paraiso Neptuno and would happily return. We specifically asked when booking for a "quiet room", having read read concerns about noise from other reviews. On arrival that is what we got - a room at the back overlooking the small internal courtyard. This was definitely a quiet room and street noise gave us no problem. Noise from neighbours was minimal. The big issue with Eden Paraiso Neptuno is its location. It is about 50 metres from Sol, which is in the UK like being 50 metres from Leicester Square - a busy place, day and night. If our room had been at the front of the hotel I think noise would have been a problem. And the location, right at the centre of the city, suited us very well - it couldn't be better. But some may prefer a less central hotel with more amenities (and a bigger bill at the end). It was perfect for us (trendy middle-aged couple)! Room a good size; staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast at 5 euros is not a sensational meal but perfectly OK at a very reasonable price. You can decide to eat on the day and the price is added to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetasyourdreams
Reviews.Content: Superb location, few steps off Sol and metro. Playa Mayor just down the street. Receptionist really friendly. Room was lovely and big facing the back, which was quiet, so can't comment on noise from the front. Spa shower looks better than it is. This hotel had a bit of a cold feel to it, in my opinion.. Advertised as free wifi, which was essential to us, as we had to book another hotel and flight for a different part of Spain. This doesn't work and I'm sure they knew this. I would only stay here if it was cheap. Always book your hotel in Spain online as their prices are always cheaper. Loads of nearby places to eat, including an eat as much as you like on the corner. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: EnvironMENTAL73
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location if you are out and about with friends - nice rooms and helpfull staff - I would deffo go back again next time I'm in Madrid -

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended at all”
Reviews.Author: gapkovskad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and in the center of Madrid ,but............ Firstly, when We made our reservation on Internet it was special offer 230 euros for four days with breakfast included. When We arrived there the chief told to us that We must pay additional money for the breakfast. And second, We were robbed by the stuff I assume by the women who was cleaning our room. I and my sister were outside all day and when We came in the evening in our room for sleep, our shopping bags with female clothes were missing from the room. We went to the reception to report that our backgage is missing but the receptionist spoke only Spanish not English at all. When we told him to go on Internet on Google translate He pretended that Internet wasn't working. We came more angrier and took the mouse from the computer and the Internet started to work. So he wanted to make full of us. The next day, We reported the robbery to the manager but he didn't do anything only couple of polite words although our bags were stolen from the hotel room. So if you traveling to Madrid don't be fooled by the shining room interior in Eden Paraiso Neptuno. Find another place to stay. Regards, Dana

Reviews.Title: “Very good, clean and unexpensive”
Reviews.Author: RaquelPonsati
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this small and nice hotel last june, it's an wonderful location, close to Puerta del Sol we went on foot to Palacio and Teatro Real and to the Plaza Mayor. Close to Calle de Huertas, and Plaza Santa Ana, where there are many bars and good restaurants. The Hotel is very new and clean, very good bathroon. The breakfeast was not so nice, but for 5 euros you can choose another cafe closer and have breakfeast. The staff is really very nice and helpfull, I really recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff! Cute and unique - not a chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityView
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and acommodating (and spoke English!). In the heart of Madrid. Very clean room with large bathroom and spread out room with a view of the street. Clean with free Wi-Fi in the first floor lounge area - couches, plants, and large open windows...very relaxing. Breakfast is available for 5 euros. Great value for the price! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: adaptabletourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic, but fine. As noted in other reviews, the beds are not too comfortable but other than that I was pleased with the hotel. The room had a small refrigerator, and the location made up for a lot. The palace, Prado and Plaza Mayor was within walking distance. The hotel was close to two metro stops, one very close to the hotel and the other all the way down Montera (There were some "street walkers" in the evening near that metro stop, which made for some interesting people watching by the McDonalds and we did not feel threatened). Most staff spoke English. Considering the cost of other hotels in the area, I did feel it was a good deal. Even with the construction going on at Plaza del Sol we were not bothered by noise. Ask for a room in the back and on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “okay value but hard mattress and nasty street”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some definite plusses, including abilty to walk to many tourist destinations, and a very friendly and competent staff. If you like being in the middle of the tourist activity, this hotel is well located. Rooms are spartan but clean. Good bathroom, esp. shower. The price was fair for what we got. However...Spanish mattresses are like bricks and this was the worst. Breakfast buffet okay value for five euros only if you like cocoa puffs and factory produced pastries in celaphane. We stayed in other two-star hotels on our trip and they were MUCH better than this one. I would give this hotel a one star. Also note that the Puerto del Sol plaza is in the middle of a messy, noisy, multi-year construction project, and it is not pretty. Also, there are sex shops and some bold prostitutes outside the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, economical, friendly - right at the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sandy_flipflops
Reviews.Content: Great place for tourists looking for a great value without sacrificing cleanliness or safety. Fantastic location right in the middle of Plaza del Sol and steps away from the Metro. Makes getting everywhere so easy. We were afraid it would be really noise, since it is in the middle of everything, but it was not. A few spirited people on the street briefly after bars close. Nothing major. The front desk staff were the friendliest people we met in Madrid. In fact, they may have been the most friendly front desk staff I have come across anywhere. They were incredibly helpful, friendly and kind. Went out of their way to assist us in every way. They readily used their computer to find out just about everything we asked--how to get somewhere, the telephone number for an airline, cost of tickets, etc. It was almost like having a research librarian at the front desk. Even let us check in before noon upon arriving from our overnight flight. The rooms are clean and completely sufficient for those wanting to explore and not stay in their room all day. Having a frige to keep drinks and snaks in was great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Em
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for all the major sights and attractions. It's very close to Sol Metro station which made it very easy to get from the airport to the hotel. The staff were really friendly and helpful and although the hotel is on a busy road in the red light district it felt very safe as there was a member of staff on the desk throughout the night. The breakfast isn't much to write home about - a very basic continental with instant tea and coffee but it's only 5E per person. The rooms were cleaned (very well) each day. Only downside was the marble floors throughout which made footsteps echo - I would advise you take earplugs. Overall this hotel was great value for a fabulous location and we had a wonderful time during our stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dletis
Reviews.Content: Really good choice in center of the town. I was really satisfied with everything

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2*.”
Reviews.Author: JD60
Reviews.Content: This is a very good, new, central, hotel. There are no vast reception or public areas. The reception desk is in a corridor. The hotel has a lift and clean comfortable rooms and there is a breakfast room on the first floor. The location is very good though I did experience some street noise as my room (upgraded by the girl at check-in from single to double at no extra charge - nice start to my stay) was at the front. I bought some ear-plugs and that solved it. It is just a 5 minute walk to Gran Via and all the shops thereon. Bearing in mind the star rating, this is just perfect for a visit to Madrid. I got a very reasonable r/o rate of €224 for four nights on Booking.com. Breakfast is €5 extra. There was no bar but there are several in the vicinity. Puerta Del Sol is a very busy area and I felt safe there. (The Police station is four doors from the hotel). The 3 receptionists I dealt with during my stay could not be more helpful. I would not hesitate in staying here if visiting Madrid again. It was good to be able to store my luggage at the hotel until it was time to go to the airport. Eden Paraiso Neptuno may not appeal to the champagne and caviar brigade but it more than served my needs. A very well-operated establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker83
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, we found the Eden Paraiso Neptuno to be more than adequate. If you are looking for luxury then this is probably not the place, but it was clean, modern and in a very central location. We realised on our second night that it is very close to the red light district, but it is close enough to the Puerta Del Sol for this not to be an issue - in other words, it is at the right end of the street. The staff were helpful and friendly and there was always someone on reception. The bathroom was another positive - the power shower was a great feature! The only negative was that we could hear the people in the room next door quite clearly, but from what I've read about other hotels in Madrid, you usually have to put up with a lot of street noise and this wasn't the case for us so I suppose a bit of noise from our neighbours was a fair compromise. For what we paid it was a great hotel - it was certainly a higher standard than a hostel and that would've been our only alternative for the same price.

HotelInfo.Name: Eden Paraiso Neptuno
HotelInfo.Address: Montera 6, 28013 Madrid, Spain
